document_title: Salmonella bacterial infection: Causes, symptoms, diagnosis, prevention
subsection_content:
Patients infected with salmonella bacteria are often infected with raw meat, poultry, eggs or egg products, and unpasteurized milk. The incubation period (time from exposure to onset of illness) can range from 6 hours - 6 days. Normally, people infected with salmonella will tend to confuse it with a common stomach ache. Among them, some typical signs include: (2)
Diarrhea; Stomach cramps; Fever; Nausea; Vomiting; Chills; Headache; Blood appears in the stool
The above symptoms usually last from a few days to a week. Diarrhea usually lasts about 10 days but can take several months before the intestines return to a stable bowel habit.
